channel.title: Humdog on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Humdog on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: anti-internet texts from the 1990s
item.description: A collection of anti-Internet texts from the mid-1990s. Each of these were written at the point just as the net was unquestionably entering its stage of hyper-growth, absorbing more and more personal time as well as gobbling up independent networks into its own. The Internet As Hyper-Liberalism (1996) argues against interconnectivity of networks. Net-ism is wrong because it is coercively expansionist. There is no inherent or inevitable technical or historical trend to a single communication network.
